body: @Kolyunya Please provide the code to the reproduce.

@SilverFire I'm using `PostgreSQL`. This issue turns to be a duplicate of the #10176 but it wasn't solved in fact.

> @SilverFire I stopped using private and protected fields in Rule classes.

This is not the solution of the problem IMO.

If we can not overcome this limitation, at a very least it must be documented in guide and class reference.
The problem is out of Yii scope: https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=53756

@SilverFire if you carefully read the page you referenced you will notice that this is the expected behavior of the PHP interpreter and the problem is right inside the Yii scope. The wrong column type is used to store serialized binary rule data. It must be a binary column, not string.

> The wrong column type is used to store serialized binary rule data. It must be a binary column, not string.

We already use binary column: [1](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/caching/migrations/schema-pgsql.sql#L18), [2](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/caching/migrations/m150909_153426_cache_init.php#L51)

Are you sure you have column of `bytea` type?

@SilverFire I think you may be referencing non-relevant code. The RBAC migration [uses](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/rbac/migrations/schema-pgsql.sql#L20) the `text` column type.

issue.title: RBAC migration: Changed `data` column type from `text` to `blob`

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Is bugfix? | yes |
| New feature? | no |
| Breaks BC? | no |
| Tests pass? | yes |
| Fixed issues | #12681 |

Changed `data` column type from `text` to `blob` to handle null-byte (`\0`) in serialized RBAC rule properly

Closes #12681
